meanings.definition: Showing or causing nervousness or anxiety
meanings.sent1: The dark forest at night was the tensest place I had ever been.
meanings.sent2: She felt tensest before her big presentation at work.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tensest expression made us all laugh as it tried to catch a laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room was so tensest, you could almost hear a pin drop.
meanings.sent5: His tensest voice quivered as he spoke about his fear of heights.

meanings.sent1: The tensest rope held the weight of the entire tent.
meanings.sent2: The fabric was tensest across the frame of the drum.
meanings.sent3: The tensest elastic band snapped and hit me on the wrist.
meanings.sent4: His jaw was so tensest, it looked like it could break under pressure.
meanings.sent5: The tensest muscles in his body ached after the intense workout.

meanings.definition: In a state of tension or strain
meanings.sent1: The rope was tensest as it struggled to hold the heavy load.
meanings.sent2: His face looked tensest as he tried to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent3: The situation became tensest when they realized they were lost in the woods.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the two countries was at its tensest point in years.
meanings.sent5: The air in the room felt tensest as they waited for the results to be announced.
